oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1946-01-19 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from January 19, 1946. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys, and performers the Old Hickory Singers, the Duke Of Paducah, Tommy Magness, Velma Williams, Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach, Minnie Pearl, and Mac McGar. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Mac McGar; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Old Hickory Singers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Roy Acuff introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Roy Acuff introduces Mac McGar -- Twelfth Street Rag (Mac McGar mandolin) -- Prince Albert commercial (Roy Acuff) -- When The Saints Go Marching In (Roy Acuff) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck) -- Prince Albert jingle (Old Hickory Singers) -- Roy Acuff introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- Darling Nellie Grey (Old Hickory Singers) -- Roy Acuff talks -- Eighth Of January (Roy Acuff calls) -- Closing statement (Roy Acuff) -- Theme (Get Along Home Cindy) -- Closing statement -- Closing statement (Louie Buck) -- Network announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Williams, Velma; Minnie Pearl; McGar, Mac; Old Hickory Singers; Duke of Paducah, 1901-1986; Magness, Tommy
